content.title: Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia Type 1 (ENG)
content.description: HHT Type 1 caused by mutations in the ENG gene encoding endoglin

key_concepts.details: Autosomal dominant mutations in ENG gene encoding endoglin, a TGF-Î² co-receptor on endothelial cells
Higher prevalence of pulmonary AVMs compared to HHT Type 2, occurring in approximately 50% of patients
Epistaxis (often earliest symptom), mucocutaneous telangiectasias, visceral AVMs
Contrast echocardiography for pulmonary AVM screening at diagnosis and periodically

content.clinical_significance: HHT Type 1 requires aggressive pulmonary AVM screening and treatment due to high prevalence

primary_sources: Faughnan ME et al. J Med Genet 2011
